description: Sapana Pradhan Malla (born November 15, 1963) is a justice of the Supreme Court of Nepal, appointed on August 1, 2016. A former member of the Nepalese Constituent Assembly from 2008 to 2012, she is a prominent advocate for women's rights. Her work in public interest litigation has addressed issues such as inheritance equality, the legalization of abortion, and the criminalization of marital rape. She is a joint winner of the 2008 Gruber Prize for Women's Rights. Malla has also served as a member of the Committee Against Torture and as president of the Forum for Women, Law & Development.
short_description: Nepalese judge, lawyer, and politician, currently serving as a Justice of the Supreme Court of Nepal.
